title: Carne en su Jugo
description: A savory, brothy Mexican beef stew featuring thinly sliced flank steak simmered in a roasted tomatillo and bacon-infused consommé. Bright acidity from tomatillos and cilantro balances rich beef and bacon flavors for a comforting, hearty soup.

ingredients.display_name: flank steak, trimmed and cut into 1/4-inch slices

ingredients.notes: halve and remove seeds if desired

ingredients.display_name: canned pinto beans, drained and rinsed
ingredients.notes: optional common accompaniment; can serve separately

steps.text: Prepare ingredients: trim and thinly slice the beef across the grain, husk and rinse tomatillos, quarter the yellow onion, peel garlic, halve and seed jalapeños if desired, chop cilantro and cut limes into wedges.
Roast tomatillos, quartered yellow onion, and jalapeños on a rimmed baking sheet under a high broiler or in a 230°C/450°F oven until charred and softened, turning once so they blister evenly.

In a heavy Dutch oven over medium heat, render bacon pieces until fat releases and bacon is crisp but not burnt; remove most of the bacon and reserve for finishing while leaving about 1–2 tablespoons of fat in the pot.
Add a tablespoon of oil if needed and sauté sliced beef in batches over medium-high heat until just browned on the edges; remove beef and set aside to avoid overcooking.

Add roasted tomatillos, onion, jalapeño and whole garlic to a blender with one cup of chicken broth and purée until smooth; strain the purée through a fine-mesh sieve into a bowl to remove seeds and large solids.
Pour strained tomatillo purée and remaining chicken broth into the Dutch oven with the reserved bacon fat; bring to a gentle simmer, add ground cumin, salt and pepper, and adjust seasoning.
Return the browned beef and most of the crisped bacon to the simmering broth; reduce heat to low and gently simmer until beef is tender and flavors meld.
If using, warm drained pinto beans separately and add to bowls or to the pot in the last few minutes to heat through without breaking down the broth.

Taste and adjust seasoning with additional salt, pepper or a squeeze of lime. Serve the soup hot topped with chopped cilantro, reserved crisp bacon, optional diced white onion and lime wedges on the side.
